page.title: 11The Friendly Society
page.content: Formed in l838 to give assistance to club members mainly agricultural workers in need such as sickness or death. Club met on Trinity Monday and walked to various farms behind a band and banner. They were given cider. Society funds were distributed at the end of the 7th year. Today there are 73 members. They walk on the Saturday after Trinity and finish with luncheon at the village hall. Death benefits are paid to members or their widows. Recently a new banner was purchased, costing Â£6OO. The previous one is in the Rural Life Museum, Glastonbury Uniquely, Long Sutton Friendly Society has been in continuous existence since foundation.
